dt: {bc}not partial or biased {bc}treating or affecting all equally

pt: {sc}fair{/sc} {sc}just{/sc} {sc}equitable{/sc} {sc}impartial{/sc} {sc}unbiased{/sc} {sc}dispassionate{/sc} {sc}objective{/sc} mean free from favor toward either or any side. {sc}fair{/sc} implies a proper balance of conflicting interests.
{sc}just{/sc} implies an exact following of a standard of what is right and proper.
{sc}equitable{/sc} implies a less rigorous standard than {sc}just{/sc} and usually suggests equal treatment of all concerned.
{sc}impartial{/sc} stresses an absence of favor or prejudice.
{sc}unbiased{/sc} implies even more strongly an absence of all prejudice.
{sc}dispassionate{/sc} suggests freedom from the influence of strong feeling and often implies cool or even cold judgment.
{sc}objective{/sc} stresses a tendency to view events or persons as apart from oneself and one's own interest or feelings.

pt.t: I can't be {it}objective{/it} about my own child

shortdef: not partial or biased : treating or affecting all equally
